column4: hi, i can't see flash-non free in 6.06, but i've enabled resps ?
hi, i can't see flash-non free in 6.06, but i've enabled resps ?
can anybody help me installing FLASH on UBUNTU for FIREFOX ?
but the wiki says there is a "flash-nonfreE" pacakge, no ?
andyet... i like t do things-wiki style
what am i missing?
i enabled them ...
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AddingRepositoriesHowto <-- doesnt match adpper
i dont have that package
how did that change?
what?
editing /etc/apt/sources.list is still the same, as is the synaptic list thingy
I just don't see what changed besides the repo names ;d
trying to get Flash, right?  I believe I just ran Firefox, went to watch a flash, popped up the plugin finder, chose manual install, and ba,
tried that, failed
did it give you any errors?
try this: sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list - then uncomment the multiverse lines and save it
then do sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
how'd it go?
works gr8
awesome :D  - there seems to be a bit of touble with synaptic enabling repos, dunno exactly what it is
yeah, there is, it's annoying, hopefully it will be fixed :|
